reviews.review_msg: Linda was everywhere with the material, it seems as though she was unfamiliar with the topics herself. I bought the textbook and didn't read it once, her lecture slides summarizes it all. If you're good at writing essays this class is an easy A. Overall lectures are dull, but marking was fair.

Linda is probably one of the best instructors in the Poli Sci department.  She puts a lot of work into her lectures and is always willing to help students.  Lectures can get a bit long but they really are useful.  Grading wise, she's a bit tough but she gives a lot of help if you ask.
Showing Hollywood movies for 2.5 hrs of a 3 hr lecture (every lecture) doesn't constitute lecturing. What a joke. Good gig if you can get it.

Ayers has is the most engaging and inspirational professor i have ever come across. She truly truly cares about her students, and teaches the material with compassion and clarity that makes complicated ideas and difficult subjects completely manageable and even fun. the world would be a better place if more profs taught like her.

Pol 344 regards international law so it is a pretty boring class. James manages to make it a total snooze fest. He is out of the country and is lecturing at what for him is the middle of the night. 0 engagement with students - he ignores questions asked in chat. Easy class to take it is just boring and insanely boring. Take home exam as well.

Absolutely unreachable online. You have to send 3 emails for him to send back a super short response 2 weeks later if you are lucky. This was especially annoying when we needed his approval for our essay topics and he would just not respond to emails. Overall, STAY AWAY from his online classes.

Long story short, we had to get his approval before writing a 15-page term paper. I reached out a week in advance and he took 4 days to reply to my emails. Showed no urgency for students. It tanked my mental health and schedule, and I ended up reaching out to my advisor and the department chair to get my late penalty appealed since he caused it.

Heard great things about James but taking him during a remote semester - he's horrible. He has no office hours so the only way to reach him was through email; but he literally either doesn't reply, replies with days in between, or replies only responding to half of your email. Basically unreachable, and not who you want as a prof during a pandemic.

if you're the type of student who likes reaching out the a prof or TA for extra clarification, I DO NOT recommend taking any courses with this prof. Getting in contact with him is impossible as he takes forever to respond to emails. He also ignores some questions in your emails if he doesn't feel like answering them.

he is a nice person, but reaching out to him is almost impossible and due to that, my marks were heavily affected. Unfortunately, in university, niceness can only take you so far. I expect a complete ability for students to access a professor, and that was impossible with James. on top of that, a very hard marker!
He is friendly with marking and knows how to teach. The best!!!
Not as bad as what others say. The course content is very direct and as long as you can read and comprehend the course notes, you'll do fine.

haunted by regret for not sending in a course eval about this Prof. the course material was easy, assignments were mostly clear. my beef is that he returned no grades after the 1st assignment of the semester, did not return any emails about getting grades/feedback on the final paper or final exam. so u got ur final mark with 0 justification

When I took this class the professor was on leave so had no office hours, but was also incredibly hard to reach with questions by email. The first assignment was supposed to be objective, but blatantly said my argument is wrong.

I have no issue with James, but if you are going to take a class of his online beware of his TA's. TA feedback was not helpful and was a bit unrealistic. I disputed my paper grade to James (successfully) because the TA didn't like the definition it was based off of. The definition I used was explicitly stated in the course material...

Took online Pol 344 - Int'l Law with James.  Course shouldnt be taught online, such a poor way to learn such material.  He takes a while to get back to you, like 2 days minimum.  Not too many assignments but ongoing online participation, cant just bs your way through the course.  Asks the big questions.  A fair bit of writing . Okay. No textbooks!

Wow, terrible online class.  Very little direction, takes a week to get back to your email, if at all. Instructions not clear and doesn't answer students questions in a timely manner. Poor feedback, no help in providing suggestions for doing better.  Project turn around time is too long. This Instructor just doesn't have the time for his students.

I found his grammar and vocabulary to be needlessly complicated. The questions on the final were a paragraph long, but easily could have been rephrased much shorter and simpler. Very little feedback on assignments. It took weeks to get a grade on the first assignment. Two weeks after class now, and still no marks for research paper or final.

I took this course online but he put a lot more work into it than other profs. He filmed his lectures & posted them online which helped enormously.  He did expect us to do readings and post weekly answers to his discussion questions but almost all my online courses require that. I would have gotten a higher mark but I didn' finish the weekly posts

The lectures were barely audible from anywhere but the front row. It was tough to tie any of the lectures into the final paper topic because nothing lined up. So I had no clue what he wanted to see as far as the paper went. VERY easy to get off topic, some lectures became glorified office hours for the in class suck ups...
Intimidating class at first, but Busumtwi-sam is extremely helpful when you ask for his assistance. Lectures were interesting - but long - and you'll come out of this class having learned something.
This prof knows his stuff and is very enthusiastic about teaching.  He runs a tight clas but is very knowledgable and clealry cares about the students. An inspiring prof.
